situation.title: Cottages and cabins
situation.meta_description: Trips to own cottages and cabins are still allowed, but only with the family.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Trips to own cottages and cabins are still allowed, but only with the family. If you are planning a trip there, do not forget to start the journey early to get to your destination before the curfew (9 PM to 4.59 AM).

Reduce contact with the locals to a minimum - we recommend buying enough food and supplies before the trip, so you do not have to leave the cottage area for unnecessary reasons. Excessive contact with locals can be a health risk to you and others. If you are planning a trip away from your accommodation, maintain extra hygienic care and wear your face mask. Do not invite people inside your accommodation and in the case of contact with local citizens, keep your two-meters distance and wear a face mask.

questions_answers.question: Can I take my friends to my cottage?
Can I take my family to my cottage?
Can I invite people over to my cottage?
questions_answers.value: No, you are exposing them and you to unnecessary health risks.

questions_answers.question: Can I go grocery shopping to local supermarkets?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but it is necessary to maintain hygienic rules (wear a face mask and keep two-meters distance).

questions_answers.question: Can I go to say hello to my auntie who has a cottage near me?
questions_answers.value: Necessary family visits are allowed, but we recommend not to expose you and others to risk of infection. In a case that the person is in the high-risk group (elderly, people with health problems etc.), give the visit an extra consideration and always maintain hygienic rules (wear a face mask and keep two-meters distance).
